nodes.bodyText: event cannot be null because it is already checked and initialized in event = ensureLoggingEvent(event);
OrderPreservingBase64.decode cannot return null.
private static final String THROTTLING_MANAGER_SUFFIX = ".throttle"; so it cannot start with .dump.
I think the original intent was the other way around, i.e. if THROTTLING_MANAGER_SUFFIX ends with ".dump" then the dump file should end in ".dump.". So please correct your fix.

substring cannot return null.
req.getPathInfo() could return null but in our case it never does because it contains at least api/v0/.
If the various endpoint paths are modified, api/v0 may disappear from them, modifying this check will then lead to an error which is not suitable.

So it still need to be fixed, as req.getPathInfo().substring(target.length()) could throw a NPE.
Fixing that.
Never used.
Always false. Used false instead in method calls to make that clear.
Should this be removed?
Yes it should, but probably as part of a coherent PR removing all mentions of archive, including from Store interface method signatures.
extractReadToken already takes care of invalid token and thus throws instead of returning null.
Previous while loop can only exit if !itermeta.hasNext().
writeTimestamp is always false.
Previous while loop can only exit if !itermeta.hasNext().

First time it is evaluated null == chunkenc so the second part is not evaluated.
After that, lastchunk is assigned to chunk, which is a long thus cannot be null.
extractReadToken already checks that the token is valid and throw if its not instead of returning null
reader cannot be null in the try clause except for the last line, which cannot throw a IOException.
Will throw NPE if the producer is not defined in the token.
Unused.

Cannot happen because already checked before.
Before the PR change, could not happen either because a NPE would have been thrown.
We're already in a if (!dryrun && doShuffle) so !dryrun is always true.
Unused.
Was reset to null at the end of each iteration of the while loop. Changed to variable defined in the loop instead.
null == decoder was always true because decoder was reset to null  at the end of each iteration of the while loop.
lastserver is always null.
lastserver should be set to tokens[0] in the loop instead of removing the check.
Is always null.
Cannot be null, checked and initialized just before.
done is always true here so make it explicit.
Could never be true, fixes wrong boolean operator.
macro is a Macro which is Snapshotable so this was only a null check.
func is always null because of line above.
Macro is Snashotable so it is always false because taken care of by the condition above.
As List is Iterable, only check Iterable.
Always true, else an error is thrown.
Remove unneeded test, add a comment to keep that clear.
Already taken care of by instanceof.
We are in an else clause that make sure we have !encoders.isEmpty(), so no need to check that.
If null != decoder then null == gts, make that explicit.
If null == decoder, make that explicit.
Breaking here will make the test in the while useless. Remove the break and leave the while end.
Always true, else an error would have been thrown.
Macro case is never reached because already taken care of by the Snashotable one.
metadata is always null, replaced by null.
readable value is known for each call.
Agreed, but keeping readable in the calls makes understanding the code simpler when browsing it without an IDE which makes the parameter name explicit.
Always true.
LEVELDB_HOME is not in REQUIRED_PROPERTIES.
Always happen in the else clause.

dr is initialized just above so null != dr is always true.
Also simplifying !a || a && b to !a || b.
iter is a MetadataIterator so this is only a null check.
Make expose value explicit.
Make the value of metadata explicit.
Never happens as modulus is initialized and is final.

startrow is always set to null or else return true; in the first part.
So the test null == startrow is always true and then startrow is reassigned to a new value.
if hasLabel, then checkLabels because hasLabel can be true only if checkLabels
Maybe, but should we check the attributes? This is what checkAttributes determines, so it is not always true.
Then add it as a comment to make the understanding easier once the clause is removed.
make that null != macro
null != iter
Leave a comment indicating this is determined by startrow having been set to null
